asyd - (28/07/2008 08:51): vmassol: is there a way to disable pdf/rtf export? for all page and/or non authenticated users and/or for a specific page?

vmassol - (28/07/2008 08:52): otherwise you could also do this at the apache level  
asyd - (28/07/2008 08:53): ok, thanks

ldubost - (28/07/2008 12:51): Hi vmassol  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 12:51): hi ldubost   
ldubost - (28/07/2008 12:51): Have you seen markus' plexus issue  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 12:52): yes and thomas and I have already answered  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 12:52): it seems he has this field that is not injected  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 12:52):   /\*\*  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 12:52):      \* Component manager used for creating queries as components.  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 12:52):      \* Injected.  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 12:52):      \*/  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 12:52):     protected ComponentManager componentManager;  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 12:53): look at the exception trace  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 12:53): his is in XWikiAction  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 12:53): he is in XWikiAction  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 12:53): also he is in a component  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 12:53): which has also been injected by plexus  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 12:53): the ComponentManager is not declared in the requirements  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 12:53): in the components.xml  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 12:54): but this tend to show that the QueryManager should not work at all  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 12:55): it's possible, this has been developed by Artem and I don't know if it's usable yet or not  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 12:55): I'll ping him on skype  
newboy - (28/07/2008 12:56): vmassol, is there a command to get the total number of sections in a document?  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 12:56): ldubost: btw it seems Artem is not using the correct plexus wayu  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 12:56): way  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 12:56): this is not how to get a component manager  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 12:57): he should instead have implemented the Composable interface if he needed it  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 12:57): newboy: I don't think so  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 12:57): now I'm not sure why he would need it, I haven't reviewed this code yet  
newboy - (28/07/2008 12:58): ldubost: and no way to do a for loop through all the sections?  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 12:58): vmassol: he is using it to get the components handling HQL and XPATH  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 12:58): yes reading it now  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 12:58): let me check the components.xml  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 12:59): ldubost: yes I have no idea how this can work the way it is...  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 12:59): newboy: the section code is not in the public api  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:00):  getSplitSectionsAccordingToTitle()   
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:00): $doc.document.getSplitSectionsAccordingToTitle()   
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:00): would give you what you need but is priviledge API  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:00): ldubost: trying to fix artem's code now  
newboy - (28/07/2008 13:00): I would, just need programming rights?  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:00): these API will probably be changed  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:00): yes it will just need programming right  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:01): if you write some code for com.xpn.xwiki.api.Document we can add it to the public API  
newboy - (28/07/2008 13:03): ldubost: that was what I wanted. is there not a document which has all these commands in it. I can't find that in http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/DevGuide/API/xwiki%2Dcore%2D1.4.1%2Djavadoc.zip/index.html  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:04): that's normal we only document the public API  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:04): the internal API WILL change at some point  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:05): so you have to look at the source code when you want to go to the internal API  
newboy - (28/07/2008 13:05): ldubost:  but only if my xwiki  version is upgraded, yes?  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:05): and use it being aware of backwards compatibility issue  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:05): yes of course.. only if you upgrade  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:06): http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/xwiki-platform/core/trunk/xwiki-core/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/doc/XWikiDocument.java  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:12): ldubost: ok fixed I think, I've sent an email to devs  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:12): (not tested though)  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:14): markus will tell us  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:20): btw ldubost you haven't commented on the recent wiki syntax mails I sent. I hope you've seen them and you agree since I'm implementing them and would hate to revert my changes ;)  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:21): i'll look  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:21): thanks  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:21): (the harder part is that I have to have the changes made in the wikimodel source tree, that's why it's hard to revert once made)  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:27): I don't understand the quote thing  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:27): is this something we currently support in radeox ?  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:27): ldubost: re {velocity}{xhtml} we could also have a parameter to the velocity macro but I don't like having 2 ways of doing the same thing  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:28): ldubost: no I don't think so  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:28): but it's in wikimodel wiki syntac parsing code  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:28): I've told mikhail  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:28): so we just need to decide if we want a syntax for it or not  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:28): if not he'll just remove it  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:28): and if we want a syntax for it he'll just add it  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:29): what is the visual result ?  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:30): right now none since I haven't implemented the onQuotation and onQuotationLine events ;)  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:30): but if we agree on ">" for example  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:30): forget that  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:30): this is how to write it  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:30): for the visual result in XHTML  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:30): we need to decide how we want to output it and style it  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:31): does it exist in WikiCreole ?  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:31): no  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:31): Yes.. but I don't really understand what it is supposed to be  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:31): ok take for exampole a mail  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:32): > initial text  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:32): my reply  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:32): "> initial text" is a quote  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:32): (if the quote char is ">")  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:33): quote in the sense "quote from another person" ?  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:34): ok found some old wikimodel page: http://wikimodel.sourceforge.net/block.quot.html  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:34): we can decide to have a syntax or implement is as a macro...  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:34): I think a macro would be enough though, wdyt?  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:34): (ldubost)  
xwikibot - (28/07/2008 13:35): XWiki.gupi was modified by XWiki.gupi (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/gupi  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:35): we do have {quote} in radeox  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:35): I prefer {quote}  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:35): at least you know that it's a quote  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:36): the reason I was asking is because several wikis have it at the syntax level  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:36): ok I understand the >  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:36): this is  something used on crao wiki  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:36): people commeting in the wiki page use this  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:37): > I like this. LudovicDubost.  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:37): >> I don't like this... VincentMassol  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:37): that's actually nice to have  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:37): keep it with >  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:37): but it's not really a quote :)  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:38): ldubost: I need to ask Mikhail if you can quote a quote  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:38): "keep it with >": does it mean you like the idea of having it in the syntax?  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:39): (anyway please answer the mail so we get your input)  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:39): yes  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:41): ldubost: ok confirmed with Mikhail, Your example would work (it supports nesting quotations)  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:41): they are treated like list items  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:44): I think we should keep it  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:44): I voted for {{ }}  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 13:44): and images in links  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:45): ok cool thanks  
continuum - (28/07/2008 13:45): BUILD ERROR: XWiki Products - Enterprise - Web http://continuum.xwiki.org/continuum/buildResult.action?buildId=38794&projectId=73  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:47): ldubost: wdyt about the nowiki macro vs a wiki syntax like {{{ }}}?  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 13:47): (I'm not sure myself even though I've already implemented the nowiki macro)  
continuum - (28/07/2008 13:53): BUILD FAILURE: XWiki Products - Enterprise Manager - Functional Selenium Tests http://continuum.xwiki.org/continuum/buildResult.action?buildId=38804&projectId=254  
continuum - (28/07/2008 13:56): BUILD FAILURE: XWiki Products - Enterprise Manager - Functional XMLRPC Tests http://continuum.xwiki.org/continuum/buildResult.action?buildId=38806&projectId=253  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:29): hi everyone, I'm going to move the SVN dirs around according to the proposal  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:29): you have a 15 minute window to shout before I start  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:29): :)  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 14:35): glooups  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:36): yep... :)  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 14:36): {nowiki} is for having nothing happening at all ?  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 14:36): {{nowiki}}  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:37): it's for no parsing the wiki syntax   
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:37): s/no/not/  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 14:37): and no parsing of macros also ?  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:37): yes since maros are wiki syntax  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:37): s/maros/macros/  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 14:38): maybe we could have some parameters for page to set the default  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 14:38): this could be usefull for doing pure HTML sites for example  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 14:38): we could say that a space is HTML  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 14:40): {nowiki} would not espace html also  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 14:40): isn't it like saying {html}  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:45): ldubost: you cannot enter html code without using the html macro  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:46): so nowiki kind of escapes html but that's also the case if you just enter html  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 14:46): hum  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:46): xhtml is for entering XHTML and it supports escaping wiki syntax or not (by default right now wiki syntax is not escaped)  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:47): you cannot not enter xhtml in the xhtml macro  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 14:47): so if we want stuff to be completely untouched  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 14:47): what would be used ?  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:47): nowiki  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 14:47): so nowiki does not escape html  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:47): (since you can only enter wiki syntax in pages...)  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:47): you can ONLY enter wiki syntax in pages  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:47): entering html is not allowed  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:48): (it's escaped)  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:48): to be more precise:  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:48): if you type "<h1>"  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:48): you'll see "<h1>" printed and if you look at the browser source  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:48): you'll see <h1>  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 14:49): so we also need a macro for pure plain text  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:49): how different is it from nowiki?  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 14:49): it's like plain.vm and plaincode.vm  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 14:49): plain.vm escapes it so that the content type stays text/html  
ldubost - (28/07/2008 14:49): plaincode.vm leaves it completely untouched  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:51): you said: "we need a macro for pure plain text"  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:51): I don't see how this is different from the nowiki macro  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 14:51): since that's what it does

newboy - (28/07/2008 15:44): vmassol:  if I want to set a section title what is the code? I know I need to use the setSectionTitle command  
newboy - (28/07/2008 15:44): is it #set (doc.getsection(num).setSectionTitle($sectitle))  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 15:44): newboy: I don't think you can  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 15:44): this won't change anything AFAIK  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 15:45): what you're trying to do is do some refactoring of xwiki page contents  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 15:45): and this is not really supported currently  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 15:45): this is why I'm finishing the new rendering code  
newboy - (28/07/2008 15:45): so what is the setSectionTitle  for in the API guide?  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 15:45): so that we can manipulate any part of the content of pages  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 15:46): right now really you should stick to manipulating the full page content only  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 15:46): newboy: I guess the set is simply to set the section title when the DocumentSection object is created  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 15:46): (meaning you can set it but it won't get saved)  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 15:46): (it's read only)  
newboy - (28/07/2008 15:47): I see, I was just using the section title of a page as a sneaky (very bad form - I'm sure) way of storing data as a kind of array  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 15:47): oh no this is not the way  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 15:47): :)  
newboy - (28/07/2008 15:47): well, I reckoned there must be a better way. but I thought that might work  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 15:47): maybe you should explain your use case and then we can tell you how to implement it...  
newboy - (28/07/2008 15:48): ok, although I don't promise it will be intelligible the first time around, if I'm not clear please ask me to repeat myself  
newboy - (28/07/2008 15:49): I have some code which will automatically generate a list of countries (stolen from your tutorial). Each country has a number of sections. I have written the code that will if given a section name will display all the countries that have that section title in them  
newboy - (28/07/2008 15:49): (each country is a wiki page btw)  
newboy - (28/07/2008 15:50): Now I want to write some code that will generate a list of all the sections in all of the countries  
newboy - (28/07/2008 15:51): my plan was to loop through all the sections for all the countries and if the title wasn't in my list of titles stored in a listoftitles page to change that page  
newboy - (28/07/2008 15:51): vmassol: does that make any sense?  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 15:58): newboy: hold on, I'm doing some complex tasks that I don't want to mess up  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 15:58): :)  
newboy - (28/07/2008 15:59): vmassol: ok, no prob I will wait

vmassol - (28/07/2008 16:29): jvelociter: yes you can  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 16:29): sorry I should have mentioned it  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 16:30): all should be fine now  
jvelociter - (28/07/2008 16:30): thanks  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 16:30): right now the only difference is that you'll need to co as many projects as you want to have locally  
jvelociter - (28/07/2008 16:30): you mean no external with all projects ?  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 16:30): (there's no global trunks externals across projects for now and I'm not sure we should have them)  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 16:30): yes  
jvelociter - (28/07/2008 16:31): ok  
jvelociter - (28/07/2008 16:31): why not ?  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 16:31): what we can have though  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 16:31): is each project can define its own externals  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 16:31): so if I'm in XE for ex  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 16:31): I can have a trunks/ dir  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 16:31): with some xternals including platform   
vmassol - (28/07/2008 16:31): and a pom.xml to build it all  
jvelociter - (28/07/2008 16:31): ok

vmassol - (28/07/2008 16:33): note: we're moving sandbox with raff  
vmassol - (28/07/2008 16:33): but having a discussion about whether we import the history or not right now
